__e: But then you wouldn't have met, and we wouldn't have met either.
I think your dad and my dad would have gotten along really well.
- That's 36 days they wouldn't have had otherwise.
If not for your father, would've been more.
Would things have been better if you'd just told her the truth?
I don't know... If I hadn't have done it, I don't know that things would have turned out any better.
Na, they'd have to try a bit bloody harder for that.
In fact, they would have to be the very best of friends.
Things are really as they should be.
And all you had to do was pretend.
I bet if were there in person they'd have to do something.
They'd have to do something pretty fast. You know, to prevent any serious, permanent damage.
I suggest you do the same. It's hard enough getting Resources to follow a suspect pre-arrest.
Please, one or two people should be there, not all of you.
Sometimes I think, if I was a better kid they wouldn't have had to drop us off at Gran's.
Then they'd have to believe us or at least ask questions.
Maybe if no one would look after him, at least they'd look at him.
They'd have to be close enough to see exactly where we were.
They would have done it anyway.
They wouldn't have rushed us if you hadn't been there...
They would have done that if that's what they came for.
They're not going to kill us, 'cause, if they were, they would've done it already, okay?
I don't know what's in their crazy heads or what their scheme is... but killing me right away isn't part of it, or they'd have done that by now.
Sleep well, guys. SCOUT: I'm going to bed, you guys.
But, they would have killed me if I didn't do it.
If I hadn't done this, then they would've killed me, sir.
